intro: Gardenia dolichantha, commonly known as the long-stemmed gardenia, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves and fragrant, white to yellow flowers. The plant belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is often cultivated for its ornamental value. It thrives in warm, humid climates and requires well-drained soil. Gardenia dolichantha is also valued for its use in traditional medicine and as a source of essential oils.
